Kernel/sources/system/cmos.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include <system/cmos.h>
00002 
00003 //Read a register from the CMOS
00004 uint8 CMOS_READ(uint8 Register) 
00005 {
00006         //Don't want to be interrupted untill the register has been read
00007         disable_interrupts();
00008 
00009         //Write the specified CMOS register to be read to port 0x70
00010         outb(0x70, Register);
00011 
00012         //Read the value of the register from port 0x71
00013         uint8 ret = inb(0x71);
00014 
00015         //Re-enable interrupts
00016         enable_interrupts();
00017 
00018         //Return the byte from the CMOS
00019         return ret;
00020 }
00021 
00022 //Write the value to the specified register of the CMOS
00023 void CMOS_WRITE(uint8 Register, uint8 Value) 
00024 {
00025         disable_interrupts(); //Don't want to be interrupted untill the new value has been set
00026 
00027         //Send the register to write to port 0x70
00028         outb(0x70, Register);
00029 
00030         //Send the new value of the register to port 0x71
00031         outb(0x71, Value);
00032 
00033         enable_interrupts(); //Turn them back on after we are finished
00034 
00035         return;
00036 }
